synapse

Class SynapseCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • base.ComponentCollection
        • base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • synapse.SynapseCollection<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SynapseCollectionGraupner2012, SynapseCollectionPfister2006

    public abstract class SynapseCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>
extends ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>

    Base class for all synapse collections. A SynapseCollection is expected to be used in conjunction with a NeuronCollection; The methods to set and get the pre- and post-synaptic neurons for a synapse reference the index of neurons in the associated NeuronCollection.

    The overridden run() method in a super-class should update the values in the efficacy array as well as the synapseOutputs array like so: synapseOutputs[synapseID] = neuronOutputs[preIndexes[synapseID]] * efficacy[synapseID]. The values in the synapseOutputs array are used to provide input to the neurons in the next iteration of the simulation.

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to set the values for pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all synapses to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if state variables other than the efficacy must be reset, or if the efficacy should be set to something other than 0. The overriding method should invoke this super-method (before doing anything else). Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        reset in class ComponentCollection
